citation.article-title: Kineosphaera limosa gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel Gram-positive polyhydroxyalkanoate-accumulating coccus isolated from activated sludge
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Kineosphaera (Ki.ne.o.sphae'ra. Gr. n. kinesis motion; M.L. fem. n. sphaera sphere; N.L. fem. n. Kineosphaera a motile sphere)
Cells are strictly aerobic, non-spore-forming, Gram-positive, motile cocci (1-2 Î¼m in diameter), which grow in pairs and packets.
Cells do not use nitrite as an electron acceptor.
The cell wall contains meso-DAP as its characteristic diamino acid.
The G+C content of the DNA is 71 mol%.
The predominant cellular fatty acid is C16:0, followed by C17:1, C18:1, C17:0 and C16:1.

The genus is a member of the family Dermatophilaceae, suborder Micrococcineae of the class Actinobacteria (high-G+C group), and contains nucleotide signatures of its family and suborder, with the exception of an A at position 1251 of the 16S rRNA gene sequence instead of a G.
The type and only species of the genus is Kineosphaera limosa.
